intro: Cineraria vagans, commonly known as the wandering cineraria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking appearance. Cineraria vagans is also known for its ability to tolerate coastal conditions, making it a hardy plant in maritime climates.
